sections.section_instructions:
Reading Passage has ten paragraphs, A-J.

Which paragraph contains the following information?

Write the correct letter, A-J, in boxes 15-20 on your answer sheet.

questions.question_text: An example of how one parrot species may survive at the expense of another.
A description of how plants may adapt to attract birds.
Example of two parrot species which benefited from changes to the environment.
How the varied Australian landscape resulted in a great variety of parrot species.
A reason why most parrot species are native to the southern hemisphere.
An example of a parrot species which did not survive changes to its habitat.

sections.section_instructions:
Choose the correct letter A, B, C, or D.

Write the correct letter in boxes 21-23 on your answer sheet.

questions.question_text: The writer believes that most parrot species

options.A: Move from Africa and South America to Australia.
options.B: Had ancestors in either Africa, Australia or South America.
options.C: Had ancestors in a continent which later split up.
options.D: Came from a continent now covered by water.

questions.question_text: What does the Writer say about parrot's beak?

options.A: They are longer than those of other birds.
options.B: They are made of a unique material.
options.C: They are used more efficiently than those of other species.
options.D: They are specially adapted to suit the diet.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is NOT mentioned by the writer as a disadvantage of nesting boxes?

options.C: They provide only shelter, not food.
options.D: There are too few of them.

sections.section_instructions:
Complete the summary below.

Choose NO MORE THAN TWO WORDS AND/OR A NUMBER from the passage for each answer.

Write your answers in boxes 24-27 on your answer sheet.

content.paragraph:
There are 345 varieties of parrot in existence and, of these, {24} live in Australia.
As early as the {25}, the mapmaker {26} recognized that parrots lived in that part of the world.
{27}, the famous painter of animals and birds, commented on the size and beauty of the Australian parrot family.
